God Bless the UFO
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Filk Songs: God Bless the UFO
By Nate Railsback on Thursday, November 16, 2000 - 05:15 pm:

(Note: This is not an original work- it's a direct copy of the Capitol Steps' song. For anyone who has not heard of the Capitol Steps, they are an awesome music/comedy group that basically does the Weird Al thing with a definate political bent. I don't know if it really fits here, but it was so hilarious, and you could KIND OF give the song to Metalners. Let's see what everyone thinks.)

God Bless the UFO
(To the tune of "God Bless the USA")

Well I just got back from Roswell-
Where the Aliens have been.
And if you ask the Feds the cause, well,
They'll only lie again.

Now I'm hunted by the gumshoes,
And wanted by the cops,
'Cause they think that I might be the guy
Makin' circles in the crooooops...

And I know that there's a conspiracy
From the voices in my head!
Elvis lives, it's clear to me!
It's McCartney who's dead!
And if the Mars men come again,
And take me, I shall go.
I will take a trip on their rocket shiiiiiip...
God Bless the UFO!

Give JFK this message:
It's the Cuban Army's fault!
And I know that Dave Koresh is
Alive inside a vault.

We've seen reports in papers
Of a guy who knows about
A car that runs on chewing gum,
But the Arabs rubbed him ouuuuuuut!

And we loudly warn that America
Is badly unprepared!
With the Cold War through,
We need something new
That can get you good and scared!
Do you wonder just who
Is warning you
Of conspiracies today?
We're the ones who fill
The rumor mill
We are the CIA------!!!

By Carl Carlisle on Wednesday, November 29, 2000 - 11:10 pm:

FNORD

By Nate Railsback on Saturday, December 2, 2000 - 10:09 pm:

? I'm sorry, I'm not familiar with that acronym.

By Carl Carlisle on Sunday, December 3, 2000 - 02:18 am:

It is refering to either the unspeakable or the hidden truths. There is a fictitious branch of the 'Illuminated Ones' dealing with extraterrestrials, that use 'FNORD' to encrypt their disinformation. Such amusing tales have inspired other stories like the 'X Files'.
